content.question: The force diagram above shows a box accelerating to the right on a horizontal surface of non-negligible friction. The tension <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is exerted at an angle of <math alttext="30 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> above the horizontal. If <math alttext="mu" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the coefficient of kinetic friction between the box and the surface, which of the following is a correct mathematical equation derived by applying Newton’s second law to the box?

choices.label: <math alttext="a, equals the fraction with numerator, T times cosine theta, minus mu M g, and denominator M, end fraction." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>T</mi><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>μ</mi><mi>M</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="a, equals the fraction with numerator, T times sine theta, minus mu M g, and denominator M, end fraction." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>T</mi><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>μ</mi><mi>M</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="a, equals the fraction with numerator, T times cosine theta, minus mu times open parenthesis, M g, plus T times sine theta, close parenthesis, and denominator M, end fraction." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>T</mi><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>μ</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>M</mi><mi>g</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>T</mi><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="a, equals the fraction with numerator, T times cosine theta, minus mu times open parenthesis, M g, minus T times sine theta, close parenthesis, and denominator M, end fraction." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>T</mi><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>μ</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>M</mi><mi>g</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>T</mi><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="a, equals the fraction with numerator, T times cosine theta, minus mu times open parenthesis, M g, minus T times sine theta, close parenthesis, and denominator M, end fraction." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>T</mi><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>μ</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>M</mi><mi>g</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>T</mi><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
